revised_title: Detection of Pus Globules in Blood During Suppuration
tldr: George Gulliver's research on suppuration led him to examine blood in fevers accompanying inflammation and suppuration. He detected pus globules in the blood using a combination of chemical and microscopic methods. This discovery supports the idea that suppuration is a form of blood analysis and that unhealthy pus, mixed with broken-down fibrin, is associated with inflammatory or typhoid fevers.
